texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you have postfix installed with OpenSSL support compiled in, you can enable SSL connections by editing two configuration files. First, add the following to /etc/postfix/main.cf:
texts.text: If you have postfix installed with OpenSSL support compiled in, you can enable SSL connections by editing two configuration files. First, add the following to /etc/postfix/main.cf:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
smtpd_use_tls = yes
#smtpd_tls_auth_only = yes
smtpd_tls_key_file = /etc/postfix/newkey.pem
smtpd_tls_cert_file = /etc/postfix/newcert.pem
smtpd_tls_CAfile = /etc/postfix/cacert.pem
smtpd_tls_loglevel = 3
smtpd_tls_received_header = yes
smtpd_tls_session_cache_timeout = 3600s
tls_random_source = dev:/dev/urandom
texts.text:
smtpd_use_tls = yes
#smtpd_tls_auth_only = yes
smtpd_tls_key_file = /etc/postfix/newkey.pem
smtpd_tls_cert_file = /etc/postfix/newcert.pem
smtpd_tls_CAfile = /etc/postfix/cacert.pem
smtpd_tls_loglevel = 3
smtpd_tls_received_header = yes
smtpd_tls_session_cache_timeout = 3600s
tls_random_source = dev:/dev/urandom

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Then, simply uncomment this line in /etc/postfix/master.cf:
texts.text: Then, simply uncomment this line in /etc/postfix/master.cf:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Make sure to keep tabs between the elements in the master.cf file.
texts.text: Make sure to keep tabs between the elements in the master.cf file.
